clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Screen Time on Recovery From Concussion
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Screen Time on Recovery From Concussion

brief_summary.textblock: This study will prospectively examine the effect of screen time on recovery from concussion. Patients 12 to 25 years of age presenting to the ED with a concussion will be randomized to allow for screen time as tolerated or to abstain from screen time for the first 48 hours of recovery. The amount of screen time use and duration of concussive symptoms will be assessed through daily surveys and a daily post-concussive symptom score (PCSS).

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until PCSS of less than 7 is achieved or up to 10 days, whichever comes first.
primary_outcome.description: The average number of days from initial concussion diagnosis until participant has a Post Concussive Symptom Scale Score (PCSS) of less than 7

secondary_outcome.description: The average total number of symptoms as reported on the Post Concussive Symptom Scale (PCSS) by participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of specific symptoms each day (Day 4-10)
secondary_outcome.description: The average total number of symptoms as reported on the Post Concussive Symptom Scale (PCSS) by participant.
The average severity of symptoms as reported on the Post Concussive Symptom Scale (PCSS) by participant.
The average severity of symptoms as reported daily by participant on the Post Concussive Symptom Scale (PCSS) by participant.
Average minutes of screen time (video games, television, computer, smartphone) as self-reported by participant on questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days until return to school/work and sports
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to return to school/work and sports, up to day 10.
secondary_outcome.description: The average number of days until the participant is able to return to routine activities such as school/work and sports as self-reported on questionnaire.
